import React from "react"; import FeedbackSection from "../FeedbackTestimonialSection/FeedbackSection"; import { clientLens, commercialLensFeedback, technologistLensFeedback, technologyLensFeedback, valuesFeedback, } from "../../constants/feedbackConstants"; function ContentAccordions() { return ( <>

I've built an excellent rapport with the clients in both HPE and EFL and help them achieve their ambitious missions. Here are some of the reflections:


Innovation and Values:

Customer DNA - HPE:

The customer dna is one of the primary modules in HPE where it revolves around studying the customer behavior and building the customer 360 data. The cdna data is the primary source for the stakeholders especially the ML team to train their models


I have single handedly  anchored  the customer dna module and has been the  primary source of contact  for the clients from Thoughtworks end. I have made an immense impact with the clients on building the cdna module which later was developed as a separate stream in HPE. 


  • Data Quality Check (DQC):

Problem/Challenge:  CDNA has different tags built for multiple teams to consume. The primary challenge in CDNA is to stabilize the long running jobs and fix the data issues from different sources. It has been a tedious task to manually check and debug the data issues for the clients. The team has spent a lot of time debugging and finding the issue rather than fixing it. 


Proposed Solution:  I came up with an idea of building the data quality layer for CDNA where I've built the data quality checks for CDNA using Great Expectations and built a separate pipeline for the data quality checks and integrated it with Airflow and generated the reports and synced to S3. When the critical checks for the data fails, then the team would be alerted regarding the same via email.


Impact:  It significantly improved the data issues that the team gets regularly when the new data comes in. This has saved a lot of time for the clients from 2 days to 10 mins and reduced their work of data profiling to a great extent as the report generated from the DQC will provide a detailed overview of where exactly the problem arises. It has also reduced the time of thoughtworks team in debugging the data issue to find where there is a spike in the data and helped to find the issue quicker and solve it accordingly


  • Optimizing and Stabilizing CDNA jobs:

Problem/Challenge:  Stabilizing the CDNA jobs has been a great challenge as the data volume is quite huge. Some jobs have taken longer time like 16+ hours because of the size of the data. In those cases, the job might fail due to memory issues or the data availability issues. Also, most of the jobs have not utilized the allocated resources which increased the cost. 


Proposed Solution: 

  1. To optimize the long running jobs, I've  migrated the existing cdna jobs to spark 3.x   which is very efficient.

  2. I've effectively allocated the resources for each job and thus achieved 85% of utility of resources.

  3. In addition to that, I've moved the aws jobs from  on-demand to spot instance   which has reduced the cost of the resources to 40%

 

Impact:  This has improved the time complexity of each job and we could run the jobs at a greater speed in a short time. The propensity job used to take 16-20 hours to run and we were able to execute it now at 6-8 hours of time. Also, this has reduced the cost of resources to the clients by 40-60%


  • Production Support:

In IDFC, we have only one person in the production support team to monitor the jobs and provide support. So, the client needs the thoughtworks support there. I've been providing support for the production support team and gave them the context regarding HPE and CDNA track and enabled them to work independently.


EFL Customer MDM:

In EFL, we are trying to build a customer MDM which is a single source of truth for all the downstream systems. Currently, EFL doesn't have a unified customer base and there were duplicate customers in the system. We are trying to find the unique customers based on the metrics like mobile number, address, pincode, etc and building customer master data.


  • Data Security:

Problem/Challenge:  Creating a security design for customer mdm has been a challenge since we do not have a dedicated infra team. Also, the client doesn't have the data security setup with them. Designing the data security layer from scratch has been a great challenge for the clients


Approach:  I've interacted with multiple teams to find the best solution for building a security layer for Customer MDM. Interacted with the thoughtworks appsec team closely to get the inputs about  handling PII data   and how to store it in the cloud with proper access control. I've explored a lot of  encryption algorithms   and done a case study to find the best suitable one for encrypting and storing the PII data. Also, I've done a case study about the  dynamic data masking   to effectively store the PII data without the load of encrypting and decrypting data.


Communication & Collaboration:

In IDFC, communication and collaboration plays a significant role in delivering the product since there were multiple vendors involved. In CDNA, there were  no dedicated BA and QA   so I took the  end to end ownership   of the product right from analyzing the requirements to deployment. I collaborated with different teams to understand the requirements and delivered it effectively.


I have worked closely with the clients, especially with the ML team to get the requirements and analyze them and bring them to production. This has created great  trust   with the clients. I have maintained a good rapport with the stakeholders so that we could understand their pain points and work accordingly. 


Example:  I have come across this scenario where there is a communication gap between CDNA and the campaign team where the variant categorisation has to be done while creating a campaign. But the way it is used in CDNA is quite different from what we have planned to do in campaign creation. I brought this into the team's attention and made the campaign team and the CDNA team work together and come to an appropriate solution at the early stage preventing the rework. This has become possible due to the effective communication that I had with cross teams


In EFL, since we work on the project from scratch, it is very important to communicate and collaborate with the clients, get their existing workflow and understand their pain points and propose the best solution to them.


I have communicated with multiple stakeholders regarding building the data security layer and interacted with the security consultant from client's end to understand how they wanted to secure the data and appsec team from thoughtworks to brainstorm the possible solutions for that.


Stakeholder Management:

In IDFC, since we work in a  multi-vendor  setup, we end up working with a lot of stakeholders involved in different parts of the project. Most of the time, we will be getting in a loop and it just keeps going on and on.


This causes a lot of time and investment loss for the clients as we end up re-working on the same thing multiple times.


When I came across this issue I took proactive steps and created a common channel which brings all the stakeholders together so that everybody could be on the same page. And I also proactively documented the progress and the dependencies which gave a better visibility for the stakeholders.


I always love to work on challenging tasks and build the best solution for the given problem. I've constantly worked on upskilling my technical expertise and pushed beyond boundaries. I've worked with  pyspark ,  airflow   and cloud services like  Aws EMR, S3, Athena and Glue . I've also worked on  Azure   and  Databricks . There were scenarios  where my tech excellence has created a great impact on the team and with the stakeholders.  Here are some of them:


Business Problem 1:  In HPE, finding the  conversion   rates of the customer plays a key role as it is the outcome of the campaigns that we have sent. On the other hand, building the conversion data for the client is a key challenge where we need to identify multiple scenario for different campaigns and based upon different metrics like customer transaction data, clicks and response data, we would need to build the conversion model


Tech Excellence:  I took this as a challenge to build the conversion model and worked on different approaches to implement the attribution logic. The attribution logic took multiple iterations and a generic logic is needed to accommodate different types of offers for credit card customers. There have been multiple issues in the legacy model where a conversion is mapped to multiple customers and a customer is mapped to different conversions. To avoid this, I have built a generic attribution logic which handles all these and is compatible with all types of offers. This became a benchmark and we have extended the attribution logic for the asset and liability customers as well


Business Problem 2:  Building a  data model for customer mdm   in EFL has been very challenging since it is going to be the standard data for all the downstream systems. It has to be generic and should be based upon the industry standard


Tech Excellence:  I took this opportunity to build the data model for customer mdm and I solely built it from scratch. I took the guidance from Madhu Podila and did the case study by referring to the best practices to build the data model. I identified the key customer attributes which best suite the clients and built a generic model that has been appreciated by the clients


Business Problem 3: Performance tuning   has become one of the milestones in HPE especially in CDNA because of the huge volume of data. There has been enormous effort required to monitor the jobs and there has been frequent failures due to the increasing customer base.


Tech Excellence:  To overcome this issue, I took the initiative to fine tune the CDNA jobs and made it work with better performance. I influenced the team and the stakeholders by explaining about its importance and took personal initiative to optimize the CDNA jobs. I upgraded the spark to the next version to utilize the features like AQE and built an effective data pipeline by splitting the job into multiple steps. I've also allocated the cluster and resource accordingly so that the job utilizes it to the fullest. I also wrote clean code and refactored it wherever possible to build a holistic product with better performance. This has increased the performance of the jobs 2X times and has created a positive impact on the team and with the clients.


Other areas of tech excellence:

In HPE, we have an internal web portal called AV master to configure the campaigns. In parallel to the data engineering tasks, I volunteered to work on the backend of AV master.  


It has been a longer time where the AV master UI has no test pipeline. I took the initiative in building a  test pipeline for AV master . My thirst to work on the infra motivated me to build a CICD test pipeline for AV master which helped the team to build a quality product.


Social change Initiatives:

  • Social change interviews:  As a thoughtworker, I've been part of the social change interviews to understand the values & culture that we hold up in Thoughtworks and ensure that it reaches out to a lot of people.

  • Gender Bias:  To create a work culture that is not gender biased, I've keenly worked on using inclusive vocabulary like they or he/she rather than specifically denoting a particular gender. I've also enabled my fellow thoughtworkers to use this vocabulary to have an inclusive culture.

  • Pride March:  I've participated in the Pride March held in the month of June in the Rajarathinam Stadium, Egmore to support the LGBTQ community.


Mentoring underprivileged college students:  I've also mentored the students in tech who have very little exposure and lack of guidance. I've mentored and tutored them and provided necessary support for their technical growth

As a technologist, I have contributed to my community in a best possible way and have provided necessary support for my fellow thoughtworkers and business partners


Communication and Collaboration:

Within my team, I have contributed in  stand-up energisers , so that the team bonding can be improved, and the team feel safe, grow and succeed. Also, I've initiated the  funtime   during the end of every sprint to have better collaboration with the team. I've anchored these team activities in both HPE and EFL.


Also, the ML team was using the excel for tracking the requirements and updates. With great effort, I enabled them to move into Jira which helped the team to track the requirements and progress in an efficient way and thus creating visibility among the team members.


I've also effectively collaborated with the data community and participated in the community events and provided them the support by knowledge transfer


Context Sharing:

I have anchored and organized the  workshop   regarding the  data quality   with clients and multiple vendors where more than  80 people   participated and appreciated the session. It helped them to set up the data quality layer for the existing jobs and build them as a part of development in the new jobs.  


I also took multiple sessions for the clients and vendors in  Tech sharing sessions   regarding spark and aws


Mentoring and Cultivation:

I have  on-boarded   people to the CDNA team and AV master. I've onboarded Hitesh, Suresh, Sashwat, Karan, Anwesha to CDNA and Rupali and Arif to the AV master. I've also provided necessary support to them when they are stuck. I've enabled them to work independently on each module.


Feedback:

I'm very receptive to feedback. I used to constantly give feedback and receive feedback from my peers and consistently work on it.


Leadership:

I've led the CDNA and the AV master backend team and has been the point of contact for the stakeholders. I've also single handedly led the customer MDM module with very minimal support. 


I've also led the data quality workshop with the client and multiple vendors


Community events:

  • I've been one of the organizers in the data community workshop on the Data privacy and security using spark and has been a trainer for external participants

  • I took sessions on the spark and data quality in the data accelerate programs which focuses on providing the training to the Grad Data Engineers and the new joinees in the data engineering field

  • I've participated in the N.O.W event which is Network Of Women, an initiative by Thoughtworks to gather women in tech and create a network. I participated in that event with enthusiasm and was able to network with the women from tech in other companies

  • I've also signed up and participated in the Converge event happened in Thoughtworks

  • I've volunteered for the code retreat for github copilot and worked on the copilot platform and gave the effective feedback regarding that


I've always worked hard for the growth of the organization and find the opportunity to make the clients and the organization grow in the best way possible.


Recruitment:

I am a top contributor in the hiring process, and recently became an anchor, so that Thoughtworks can interview more people and choose from a wider selection of candidates.


I've extensively participated in the recruitment activities and have helped hire more than  25 thoughtworkers   and helped in scaling the organization to the next level. I've initially shadowed and then paired for the code pairing interviews and now I'm  anchoring the code pairing interviews   for data engineers and  pairing   for the  technical interviews   I and II


I've also been a part of the  on-campus interview   for Grad happened in the St'Joseph's campus and extensively anchored the code pairing round and paired for the technical interviews


I have also  reverse shadowed   for few code pairing interviews


Excellence with client / leadership:

In CDNA, there was a dedicated data analyst team and when they got rolled off, I've filled the gap of the data analyst by taking additional ownership of studying and analyzing the data without compromising to play the key data engineer role. This has created a great impact with clients and thoughtworks was able to own the complete CDNA module eliminating the need for other vendors.


I've also stressed the importance of creating a separate team for CDNA by highlighting the pain points and enabled the client to hire more thoughtworkers into the CDNA module and stabilized it


I've also took the complete ownership of CDNA in HPE and the customer MDM in EFL by managing and leading multiple vendors and thus earned the trust of clients by exhibiting a great leadership skill


As a proud thoughtworker, I've always valued the thoughtworks culture. Here are some of the reflections regarding the values:


Global First:

I have always considered the global business needs first rather than individual needs or certain teams. I've always laid a hand for the recruitment team for hiring which impacts the global business at a greater extent. There are times where I've extended my working hours to cope with both project work and the recruitment activity.


I've always given priority to the global needs and I was flexible in switching to a project based upon the global team needs and able to contribute to it effectively with my technical expertise.


Curiosity:

I've always been curious to learn more about the unknowns and keep questioning things till I get a clarity. This curious mindset has helped me to grow exponentially. For example, I was curious to know more about CICD pipelines and have very little knowledge about that. So, I took one of the technical debt in the CICD pipeline to create a test pipeline for AV master and I've built it which has helped the team a lot. My curiosity in learning has created a great impact in the team.


Inclusivity:

I have always been a  great team player   and take immense effort in bringing the team together. I used to take initiative in the  team building activities   where I would bring the whole team together and try to connect them.


Cultivation:

I always have a cultivating mindset and try to share my learnings with my peers and team. I used to have a tech huddle with the team and learn together with them. I've also participated in lunch and learn to learn and grow as a team


Courageous:

I have asked the right questions and been bold in raising my concerns with the team. I have called out when I felt that something can be done in a different way. For example, I've been bold in communicating about the ad hoc tasks that come in every sprint from the stakeholders and that was affecting the sprint tasks and the deliverables. So. I've talked about it and the team has addressed this by setting up a pre sprint planning meeting to communicate the changes upfront. 


Integrity and Pursuit of Excellence:

I've always done the right things without any compromise. There are instances where the vendors/stakeholders need to build and deploy something on an urgent basis which is not actually the team's priority whereas it will be the individual's timelines. Once, I got to work on the corporate salary tags and they came up with a sudden change in the requirement which needs to be built and deployed on the same day which is Friday and if something goes wrong, the production data will be corrupted and lead to a lot of additional work and the team couldn't provide enough support as it is a weekend. This is not the right thing to do. So, I explained to them about the consequences and made them realize it is not appropriate to do so. I've convinced them and upon their consent, we have properly estimated the task and completed accordingly.


My future focus area is to emerge and evolve as a prominent data engineer and solutionize the challenges in the data engineering field like handling huge volume of data and focus more on the challenges in the data governance and data privacy


I would also like to work on the data streaming platforms and learn about tools like Kafka to extend my expertise in data engineering


I would also like to focus more on the leadership skill as it is necessary irrespective of any role.


I would also like to contribute more to the society and be part of every social change activity happens in Thoughtworks and in the society and become a more socially responsible person


); } export default ContentAccordions;
